page.title: 20TRADITIONAL GAMES
page.content: The old traditional game of"{Nor"}and {"Spell"}or"{Knur"}and"{Spell"}was played in this area. There were fiercely fought competitions between players from Worrall and Oughtibridge, many of the older residents today remember the game.It was played on Devil's Hill,a field near Low Ash Farm.The players used a long stick of cane or hazel,to the end of which was fixed a solid piece of wood.This stick was used to hit the edge of the "spell"which was the receptacle on a spring,holding the small wooden or pottery ball,the "nor".The player struck the ball as it rose into the air,and the various stakes placed on the ground determined the score by showing how far the ball had been struck.The game required great skill. During building, old balls have been found.
